message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a data augmentation technique for visual recognition tasks, specifically focusing on improving object localization accuracy in the weakly-supervised setting. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions that the technique can be applied to other recognition tasks like image classification, semantic segmentation, and person re-identification, which are also within the scope of cs.CV. 

The paper also mentions that the technique can work with any network to improve its performance, indicating that it may be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper's focus on improving performance through data augmentation also suggests that it may be relevant to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. 

The paper mentions that the technique can be applied to videos, which suggests that it may be relevant to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions that the technique can be applied to emotion recognition, age/gender estimation, and other recognition tasks, which suggests that it may be relevant to the natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-category.
